# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is how you can implement the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(str, ' ') # Split string into words
    wrapped_str = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_str) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_str *= "\n" # Add a new line
        end
        
        wrapped_str *= "$word " # Append the word to the string
    end
    
    return wrapped_str
end
```
You can use this function like so:

```julia
print(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.", 10))
```
This will print:
```
Lorem
ipsum
dolor
sit
amet,
consectetur
adipiscing
elit.
```
